title: Every time i see someone say tryhard i think of this

replies.body:
I still remember getting my ass kicked by a Karma in mid as Ahri. My duo partner was *losing his mind*, screaming about *tryhards* and *winner mentality*. I told him to settle down, I was learning a bunch, hadn't seen Karma in a bit, yada yada.

After the game, my friend messaged me. The Karma was ~#300 in North America, just playing a warm-up before a few ranked games.

If people say try-hard, they're idiots.

> [{quoted}](name=Seraphic Elegy,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=oHZ5RwbM,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-19T17:19:20.250+0000)

> 
> After the game, my friend messaged me. The Karma was ~#300 in North America, just playing a warm-up before a few ranked games.
> 
> If people say try-hard, they're idiots.

Well,I'm not sure,in some rare occasions "tryharding" can be pretty gay.

Have you ever played against a 5 man well practiced ranked team in a normal when they play in all seriousness? It's insanely obnoxious and the(communcation) advantage is very apparent,another case is people who play on a smurf,rush a le blanc buy,and spam blind pick.

Tryharding CAN be very gay,but people usually use the term inappropriately.

That's probably the only case of actual "tryharding" I can think of. I don't mind getting completely stomped bot by an overly aggressive duo. I don't mind when we're facing a team filled "lcs pick" champs and our team ends up getting outplayed all the time

But when it's one of those teams that go double TP, 5-man gank bot lane, gets drag, lights up the jungle like a christmas tree and then simply plays the 5-man pick-up game while securing every single objective one after the other, the game simply becomes boring. 

I mean, I usually play with 2-3 friends myself, but we very rarely actually abuse (or use, if anything), the whole "We're all together" advantage. We pretty much just play the game normally while laughing at each other's fails.

also

> [{quoted}](name=Reazale,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=oHZ5RwbM,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-19T21:00:43.119+0000)
>
> If its a fanman premade and they want to play like that , might as well play ranked...

These are both pretty poor attitudes. This is a team game that actually encourages friends to get together and you know, play the game. There are plenty of reasons that a 5 man pre-made may want to play in a normal. 

* Maybe they are warming up. 
* Maybe some of their friends haven't played in a while.
* Maybe they are trying out some strategies.
* Maybe they are experimenting.
* Or maybe they *just don't want to play ranked*.

This is the attitude the OP is talking about. Just because they are in a normal doesn't mean they have to "sandbag" their game. They don't have to play poorly or play down. They conversely don't have to go to some other land (ranked) and play on the competitive ladder just because they happened to get 5 people together.

If you get beat by a pre-made in normals it doesn't mean they need to be tossed into another game mode so that you might win the next one. Get more coordinated with your team (the ones you brought with you and your "temporary teammates"), work on the parts of the game where you are losing (like vision control), work on your own play. Don't just decide to punish 5 friends having fun just because they played that particular game better than your team :\

So, we should just accept the fact that their version of fun is ruining everyone else's?  Fuck that.  If they are trying a new comp or something, fine, but if they are dropping deep wards in a normal and 4 man roaming for ganks, then fuck it.  I'll just afk farm and wait until the surrender.  There is NO reason whatsoever to keep playing that game, because that is what they want, and I don't have to let them have it.

If they are obviously just having fun, I'll never notice that they are even a premade team.  If the communication advantage is painfully obvious and they are doing things that most only do in ranked, then seriously, fuck them, fuck you, and I'll punish them by denying them their fun just like they are doing to us.

> [{quoted}](name=LeeDark,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=oHZ5RwbM,comment-id=00000000000000020000,timestamp=2015-03-20T05:24:35.311+0000)
>
> So, we should just accept the fact that their version of fun is ruining everyone else's?

This is just silly. You aren't talking about a team who is flaming all chat, trolling the enemy, etc... you **are** talking about a team that is using good game knowledge, mechanics and skill. 

>  Fuck that.  If they are trying a new comp or something, fine, but if they are dropping deep wards in a normal and 4 man roaming for ganks, then fuck it. 

Bad news. Dropping deep wards, whether a normal or ranked, is good habit and practice. It is how you gain knowledge so you can make better informed decisions in the game. You don't want them to have that knowledge? Get some sweepers and pinks, learn to clear out and control your half of the map. **Warding** is not an advanced tactic, it's a foundation skill of the game.

  As for the 4 man goon squad, that is how you destroy an unorganized team that has no concept of warding. Ward up and catch them walking through the fog of war / overextending all day. It's an easy concept. You don't go where you don't have vision or else you risk your life.

> I'll just afk farm and wait until the surrender.  There is NO reason whatsoever to keep playing that game, because that is what they want, and I don't have to let them have it.

This statement clearly shows what you actually want : to win. Without having to put any effort in. Seriously? You will just afk farm and surrender just because a team is more coordinated than yours? Just because they are playing the game differently from you so they should be tossed in a different queue so you can get a match you can win easily? **Of course** they want to keep playing the game, that is why they queue'ed up. However, they probably also wanted a good game. Just because they are more coordinated than your team (remember, this complaint was about being outplayed with 2-3 of your own friends) or just more skilled / versed in the game doesn't mean they are jerks or some smurfing ranked team. I have been in some incredibly coordinated pug teams where we all were just on the same page.

> 
> If they are obviously just having fun, I'll never notice that they are even a premade team.  If the communication advantage is painfully obvious and they are doing things that most only do in ranked, then seriously, fuck them, fuck you, and I'll punish them by denying them their fun just like they are doing to us.

Seriously? You just have this sixth sense that knows they can't possibly be typing to each other ever? You also have a sense that prevents you from communicating with your team? Really, if "doing things that most only do in ranked" means dropping wards, picking people off for playing poorly, and being coordinated are just things people do in ranked, what kind of games are you playing? Are we complaining about 5 man ARAM teams here? We are talking about summoners rift normals right? Where foundational skills include but are not limited to 1) Drop a ward 2) capitalize on mistakes 3) talk to your team.

*You* are mad because you are being outplayed and blindly running at the enemy nexus will no longer work. You want games handed to you and better players will not let that happen.

* Learn how to get vision control or at least deny vision in your own territory
* Talk with your team / learn communication
* Learn base tactics in this game (ex. goon squad; which is countered by vision btw) and what to do when you encounter those tactics

I get that you were using a tactic / gameplan where you didn't have to ward or do any of this stuff. Now it's not working and that is frustrating. However, you have to learn how to beat those tactics. You can't just say they play better than me and that ruins my fun. What makes you so entitled? You are not complaining about them flaming, trolling, etc... You are strictly complaining about the way they play being effective against how you play. If you want a straight up stomp game by running down lanes, play co-op vs ai or custom games. When you go into PvP you accept that you are going to have to deal with a variety of teams and tactics. You will win some, you will lose some. Don't be mad just because other teams have a playstyle that punishes yours and you don't know how to fix it. Learn how to fix it.

Or the moment when a laner dcs, you have to cover his lane as a jungler, ask the enemy team to be fair and play relaxed, and they rush dragon and lit up your jungle to pick you when trying to roam

If its a normal I might take it easy, if its a ranked I'm going to abuse my advantage as much as possible.  I've seen far too many games thrown because a team started fooling around in a 5v4 only to have the enemy dc'd player come back and stomp them.  I even won what was a largely 3v5 match that way.  Leona dc'd early, our ADC was amazing and managed to stay alive and gain level advantage, I began to get fed mid as Vik and top Malphite did well too.  25 minutes in our Yi, who was decently farmed, disconnected and enemy team tried to push for Viktory but between me and the ADC's insane damage and waveclear and Malph's peel we held off, each fight getting further ahead in levels and gold.  We would have eventually lost but right about that time we were hitting level 18 Yi reconnected followed soon after by an extremely apologetic Leona.  The next teamfight we didn't just beat them, we obliterated them, and immediately shoved to nexus and won.

Ok, let me step into this real quick, because apparently you don't wanna hear this from an actual gay person. Gay does not have more than two *denotative* meanings: happy and homosexual. The most probable way for the extra uses of this term to become so widespread is that people who hated gays started to direct the term towards anything they don't like; or it could be that my generation started calling anything anyone did that was slightly non-macho gay (I can still remember when this started, and I'm really hoping my friends and I aren't really partially responsible for such a horrible social norm).

Now, when you say "gay", people will understand that you just mean to say it's not a good thing. However, that connotative meaning is a problem in of itself. The reason we shouldn't use "gay" as a negative term isn't because we might offend someone. It's because when we do, we associate 'gay' with 'bad'. Homophobia is already rampant enough without subconscious correlations between, for example, Teemo players and the LGBT community.

And you might think "That's a load of bull, that's not how the brain works" but think about that study where psychologists gave children a white doll and a black doll and asked which one was good and which was bad (I don't know how old/educated/socially aware you are, but if you've never heard of this that's the TL;DR). The children, who weren't even really old enough to understand the concept of racism, still decided the black doll was bad, because the concept had worked it's way into their subconscious already. The study that was done back in the Brown v Board days kinda makes sense, because there were literally people screaming out that being black was a bad thing. But they repeated the study more recently, and found the same results. The chances of anyone saying it to them point blank are extremely low these days, so you can conclude that some part of American culture has an underlying prejudice that even a child can pick up and apply to their psyche.

Now maybe you're not mature enough to understand this concept (many people will grow old and die without ever reaching the level of maturity required to truly care about others and try to enact change), but at the very least, "tryharding CAN be very gay"?
